page.title: 12Tourism in Dale
page.content: Dale attracts a great number of tourists, particulaly in the summer months. Most visitors come because of the excellent watersports facilities (easy launching and unloading of boats plentiful storage, Yacht Club, moorings, chandlery and repair shop, sheltered water, regattas and races, picturesque places to visit by water). Others come for the quiet beauty of the landscape or to study the birds, flowers etc. Families with children appreciate the fact that there is safe bathing and plenty of sand, rock pools and space. There are 3 hotel/guest houses with a total of about 45 beds, with 230 more beds in self-catering accomodation. The holiday houses and flats are sited in among the residential housing. There are no camp sites. Caravans and tents use farm fields subject to National Park rules
